(Mr. Thomassons subjects are video game history, graphics and game design.)

title: Amnesty by Russians Includes Greenpeace Case
description: MOSCOW  A sweeping amnesty that is underway in Russia was extended on Tuesday to a member of the crew of the Arctic Sunrise, the Greenpeace International ship seized on the open seas three months ago.

title: BEST OF 2013
description: These 15 stories showcased boldness, simplicity and independence in womens dressing.

title: Filling in the Outlines of a Dickens Character, This One Real
description: A brooding, enigmatic beauty strides across a beach in Margate, England, during the opening moments of The Invisible Woman. The year is 1885. In a nearby school, a group of boys, rehearsing a play by Wilkie Collins (Tom Hollander) and his friend Charles Dickens (Ralph Fiennes), awaits her return. We soon learn that the distraught woman, Nelly (Felicity Jones), is married to the schools headmaster, George Wharton Robinson (Tom Burke). As the films production notes put it, For Nelly, the rehearsals are igniting memories of a lost life, one that is still haunting her.

title: Exploring Anti-Semitism in Hungary
description: The Times will be taking a deep look at anti-Semitism in Hungary this coming year. As we report on this issue, we hope to hear from Hungarian Jews on their experiences.

title: Times Minute | Health Care Deadline
description: Also on the Minute, an examination of Valley Girl Speak and a performance of a scene from "It's a Wonderful Life: The 1946 Live Radio Play."

title: Best of 2013 | The Year in Womens Fashion
description: These 15 stories showcased boldness, simplicity and independence in womens dressing. Read

title: Times Minute | Health Care Deadline
description: In the Video

title: De Blasios Daughter Reveals Substance Abuse
description: Days before her fathers inauguration, the 19-year-old daughter of Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio disclosed a history of drug and alcohol abuse that his campaign had taken pains to shield throughout a candidacy that relied heavily on the image of a happy and tight-knit family from Brooklyn.

title: Housing Recovery May Be Running Out of Steam
description: The housing recovery in the United States could run out of steam in 2014. Banks are likely to tighten lending standards once new rules come into place. Rising interest rates may drive down home loan volume, too. Cash purchases by investors could set a floor for house prices, but they may not be enough to prevent a major slowdown.

title: Seals of Approval for Home Health Care Providers
description: FINDING someone to care for an ill or aged relative at home can be challenging. Sorting through the options can be time-consuming, and the need to find help may arise during a crisis, when decisions must be made quickly.

title: Wheelies: The Lightweight Heavy Duty Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: American Express to Pay $75 Million Over Credit-Card Practices
description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has ordered American Express to pay more than $75 million to settle claims that it charged improper fees and misled its credit card customers over so-called add-on products like identity fraud protection.

title: Change Comes Slowly for Bulgaria, Even With E.U. Membership
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  As Ukrainian protesters camp out in their capital to demand closer ties to Europe, Boris Rangelov, a student protest leader in Bulgaria, has a sobering message from the cold capital of his country, another former Communist nation but one that, unlike Ukraine, joined the European Union years ago: Change takes a long time.

title: In South Sudan, Reports of Massacres and Mass Graves
description: In a video report from Bentiu, in South Sudan, published on Tuesday, a United Nations official described how civilians have been fleeing the violence and taking refuge at the bodys mission there. It showed civilians gathering belongings, forming long queues to receive assistance and being treated for wounds.

title: Time Warner Cable, Bruised After Its Battle With CBS, Extends Viacom Deal
description: SpongeBob SquarePants will continue to bubble into homes on Time Warner Cable uninterrupted into the new year.

title: Sphinx Awards Highlight Promise Among Young Musicians
description: TheSphinx Organization, a national training program devoted to getting black and Hispanic students involved in classical music performance, announced the winners of its 2014 artist scholarships on Tuesday. The awards, for musicians in the early stages of their careers who demonstrate, as Sphinx puts it, artistic excellence, outstanding work ethic, a spirit of determination and great potential for leadership, include a $50,000 career-development scholarship and the organizations Medal of Excellence.

title: Streisand Sees Ill Eat You Last at Last
description: It was the question that loomed over Broadway last spring: Would Barbra Streisand attend a performance of Ill Eat You Last, the one-woman play starring Bette Midler as the real-life Hollywood agent Sue Mengers, whose falling-out with Ms. Streisand is the juicy meat of the show? Ms. Streisand never went, but her publicist confirmed this week that the actress and director did see Ill Eat You Last during its run this month at the Geffen Playhouse in Los Angeles.

title: He Can Balance a Checkbook, but Not His Imagination
description: As imagined by Ben Stiller, Walter Mitty is a man out of step with his time. An archetypal daydreamer introduced to the public by James Thurber as a henpecked suburban husband and later impersonated on screen by Danny Kaye as a misunderstood, starry-eyed sweetheart with a lovely singing voice, Walter has evolved into a modern office drone with an unusually active fantasy life. He is also, in some respects, the opposite of just about every other comic hero in American movies today, including many played by Mr. Stiller. And The Secret Life of Walter Mitty, directed by Mr. Stiller (who takes the title role), has a dreamy, melancholy tone quite different from what you might expect to find in a big-budget holiday comedy.

title: 13 Solutions for Fighting Crazy Ants
description: Almost as lively as Jon Mooallems recent story about crazy ants  who are so relentless they even swarm inside electronics, killing appliances and themselves  were the comments that followed that article. Readers offered their own creative methods for stemming the insect invasion:

title: Is the Internet a Mob Without Consequence?
description: The immediacy and fast pace of the Internet can be magical. But when someone makes a comment that the masses disagree with, a mob with 140-character pitchforks can develop in seconds and the Internet can become terrifyingly bellicose.

title: In Lyon, Artists and Designers Light Up the City
description: Lyon, Frances third-largest city, was made for Christmas.

title: Ice Storms Leave Hundreds of Thousands in the Dark
description: Hundreds of thousands of people from Michigan to Maine were expected to be in the dark on Christmas even as electrical crews raced Tuesday to restore power to homes after a weekend ice storm caused widespread blackouts.

title: Chimes Stop at Manhattan Church, but Neighbors Are Wary
description: A Manhattan Roman Catholic church whose bells have riled its neighbors this holiday season now seems to be ringing in Christmas with silence.

title: Maoists to Join Nepal Assembly After Ensuring Election Inquiry
description: NEW DELHI  Nepals main Maoist party agreed on Tuesday to join the Constituent Assembly and participate in writing the final chapters of the countrys constitution, ending more than a month of uncertainty.

title: An Old Flame Shows Up, but Who Invited the Witch and Monsters?
description: Between the prospect of Hollywoods sexing up a legendary Japanese story with rampaging C.G.I. monsters and the eager reports of a protracted production, there has been ample opportunity to hobble 47 Ronin long before its warriors finally emerge in theaters. But say what you will about this fantasy adventure, set in a land shrouded in mystery (per the opening voice-over), its still a studio movie adaptation of a story that ends  centuries-old spoiler!  with mass ritual suicide. Credit due for that bit of faithfulness, I suppose  and Merry Christmas, by the way.

title: An Animated Tribute to Andre Cassagnes
description: The creator of the Etch A Sketch gets his own treatment.

title: Bettman Upholds Thorntons Long Suspension
description: N.H.L. Commissioner Gary Bettman rejected an N.H.L. Players Association appeal of Bruins forward Shawn Thorntons 15-game suspension Tuesday, calling Thorntons Dec. 7 attack on Penguins defenseman Brooks Orpik both intentional and dangerous.

title: Musharrafs Treason Trial Is Postponed
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The scheduled opening on Tuesday of treason proceedings against the former military ruler Pervez Musharraf was put off until the new year after bomb materials and handguns were found along his route to the trial, officials said.

title: One Media Player to Rule Them All
description: Real estate is an expensive commodity in New York City.

title: A Video Chat App Called Spin Invites a Party
description: Not everyone can be home for the holidays, and although technology offers a solution, video conferencing seems a little sterile between family and friends. But a free iOS app, Spin, offers a kind of video conferencing that is less formal, simple and more fun. Its like a souped-up version of Apples FaceTime.

title: Yusef Lateef, Innovative Jazz Saxophonist and Flutist, Dies at 93
description: Yusef Lateef, a jazz saxophonist and flutist who spent his career crossing musical boundaries, died on Monday at his home in Shutesbury, Mass., near Amherst. He was 93.

title: When Greed Was Good (and Fun)
description: Future archaeologists, digging through the digital and physical rubble of our long-gone civilization in search of reasons for its collapse, will be greatly helped if they unearth a file containing The Wolf of Wall Street, Martin Scorseses three-hour bacchanal of sex, drugs and conspicuous consumption. Then as now, the movie is likely to be the subject of intense scholarly debate: Does it offer a sustained and compelling diagnosis of the terminal pathology that afflicts us, or is it an especially florid symptom of the disease?

title: Genius or Insanity?
description: Heres to the crazy ones  the misfits, the rebels, the troublemakers, the round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently  theyre not fond of rules, and they have no respect for the status quo.   Steve Jobs

title: Planning a Trip: Guidebook Versus the Web
description: I recently asked my friend Doug if he still uses guidebooks to plan his trips abroad. Hes a smart guy and a veteran traveler, so I figured he would have a thoughtful reason one way or the other. He did not.

title: Cracker Barrels Top Investor Considers Bid for Company
description: Cracker Barrels largest shareholder urged its board on Tuesday to consider selling the company  to him.

title: Big Data Becomes a Mirror
description: Why do English speakers say drove rather than drived?

title: Q. and A.: Detective Novelist Qiu Xiaolong on Chinese Corruption
description: Qiu Xiaolong, the detective novelist and poet, was in the middle of a talk in Beijing about his latest Inspector Chen novel, when a member of the audience jumped in with a question: Did Mr. Qiu think there were many undiscovered corpses in China these days as a result of crime and official corruption?

title: Sign-Up Period Extended Again for Health Plan
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said Tuesday that it would provide more time for people to complete their applications for health insurance if they could show that they missed the deadline because of problems with the federal health care website.

title: Ahem, Ummm, Well ...
description: Public speaking can give you the willies. Even the most seasoned speakers worry that they will be exposed as frauds, or purvey all the narrative excitement of televised fishing. They worry that they will have to refer by name to Turkmenistans president, Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedow.

title: Poised to Marry a Prince? She Will Not Be Spared
description: Any potential royal bride running the feverish gantlet of the British tabloids must prepare to have her name mangled. Diana, soon to be the princess of Wales, became Shy Di, and Kate Middleton, now duchess of Cambridge, was transformed into Waity Katie because of the long time she dated Prince William before they were engaged.

title: Rethinking How to Split the Costs of Carbon
description: It is probably a safe bet that very few Americans unwrapping a brand-new iPhone left under their Christmas tree are thinking about its impact on the global climate.

title: Ever True to You, Dear BlackBerry
description: Just last year, Beyonc Knowles was photographed holding the BlackBerry Bold P9981, a model designed by Porsche that sold for more than $2,000.

title: From Wolf to Sheepish Clothing
description: In Martin Scorseses new film, The Wolf of Wall Street, it is not hard to tell when Jordan Belfort, the high-finance hustler of the 1990s, played by Leonardo DiCaprio, has officially made it on Wall Street: His suits go from billowy, double-breasted, off-the-rack numbers to lordly pinstripes, complete with a chunky gold Rolex watch, Gucci loafers and a giant red silk tie.

title: Long Forgotten: A Last-Place Finish, and Razors
description: By the time the Boston Red Sox had defeated the St. Louis Cardinals in the 2013 World Series to win their third title in 10 years, most of the team resembled the cast of Duck Dynasty  had the reality TV stars decided to really let themselves go.

title: 3 Surprises: Daring Play, Thrilling Win and Wedding
description: About 10 minutes remained in the N.C.A.A. womens regional semifinal between Louisville and Baylor in March. Baylor was the defending national champion. Brittney Griner, its 6-foot-8 center, had blocked more shots in her career than any male or female player in college basketball history.

title: Detroit Wins $55 Million in Concessions From 2 Banks
description: The struggling city of Detroit said on Tuesday that it had won rare concessions, worth $55 million, from two large banks that sold it a type of financial contract that normally cannot be reduced, even in bankruptcy.

title: Rare Arias on a Lean Budget
description: The idea might sound familiar: An opera company leaves its home for an itinerant life performing a handful of new or rare operas each year at venues across New York.

title: A U.S. Comeback Lifts a Yacht Club
description: Norbert Bajurin, owner of a San Francisco radiator shop and commodore of the Golden Gate Yacht Club, was exhausted. It was July. The club was empty. Out the windows, a pair of catamarans, their sails stretching 13 stories tall and their hulls lifted above the water by engineering audacity, slid across San Francisco Bay, practicing for the Americas Cup.

title: House Hunting on Sardinia
description: The Italian market has been flat since the start of 2012, but Sardinia presents a contrast, with wealthy buyers competing for seafront properties.

title: House Hunting on ... Sardinia
description: 3 MILLION ($4.1 MILLION)

title: Toad, Mole and Badger Leap to a Bigger Stage
description: LONDON  Let my creatures live again, says the narrator at the start of Will Tucketts stage adaptation of The Wind in the Willows, the childrens book by Kenneth Grahame that has been beloved here almost since it was first published in 1908. The characters do live in Mr. Tucketts version, the first Royal Opera House production to transfer into a commercial theater in the West End of London, opening last week and running through Feb. 1.

title: Soldiers Fighting, but Coping Most of All
description: You can tell from the title that Lone Survivor is not messing around. Spoiler sensitivity is for sissies and dilettantes: Real men face the inevitable with stoical resolve. So when the movie sends four guys on a dangerous mission, you can be reasonably certain that only one of them is coming back, and you already know (as soon as the credits are over) that it will be the one played by Mark Wahlberg.

title: The Year in Questions
description: Oh, the news out there is frightful. But a quiz is so delightful.

title: Giving Voice to Early Mahler
description: Setting a benchmark for beauty in a voice, as in anything, is naturally a highly subjective endeavor. A sound one listener may consider distinctive may prove grating to another. Even some of the most beloved singers, like Maria Callas, had their detractors.

title: Daredevil on a Snowmobile
description: This Op-Doc celebrates the achievements of Caleb Moore, a competitive snowmobiler who was the first to fatally crash at the X Games.

title: Fit for a First Lady
description: I LOVE MY DESIGNS, Anni Kuan said the other day, her exuberance as unforced as her curve-grazing dresses, cocoon coats and boot-cut pants that lend a touch of raciness to her otherwise low-key designs.

title: Daredevil on a Snowmobile
Does Anchovy Gelato Go With White Wine?
description: Artichoke gelato, tomato-basil sorbet, carrot granita. The list may seem more suited to a creative restaurant menu than a gelateria. But Romes top artisanal producers have turned to savory flavors to gain an edge in a city where thousands of gelato shops compete for customers. And with the country in the economic doldrums, their unconventional flavors are reaching more gelato fans than ever, as plummeting commercial rents have allowed even more gelaterias to open or to expand existing brands.

title: At Dover Street Market, Differences of Opinion
description: At the newly opened Dover Street Market New York on 30th Street and Lexington Avenue, walls are covered with polka dots and shoes are sprinkled in glitter. There are seven small floors, stacked on top of one another like a treehouse, reached by a clear glass elevator that slowly moves through the center of the store.

title: Is a Home Bar in My Living Room an Asset or Liability?
description: Q. I have a home bar at one end of my living room. Is this an asset or liability for selling?

title: Sales at Room & Board, John Robshaw and Others
description: Room & Board is discounting some sofas, tables, storage pieces, rugs and decorative accessories up to 50 percent (the Soren lounge chair in maple with ebony stain, originally $649, is about $500); 105 Wooster Street (Prince Street), 212-334-4343, roomandboard.com.

title: In Spacewalk, Astronauts Complete Repairs to Station
description: NASA astronauts on Tuesday completed urgent repairs to the cooling system of the International Space Station that should return it to normal operation within a few days.

title: Say Cheese
description: A restaurateur has taught himself to raise livestock and make dairy products on an island near Seattle.

title: A Table-to-Farm Pioneer
description: In the 22 years since Kurt Timmermeister bought four acres of rocky, suspect farmland here for $100,000, he has had his ribs broken by an amorous female cow, lost a lamb to a crow that pecked its eyes out, and recoiled from the cannibalism of his chickens (when they werent eating one another, they were picked off by raccoons), among other blood- and mud-flecked dramas.

title: Interactive Gets a New Meaning
description: It may be the most memorable sex scene of the season.

title: Rodolfo Hernandez, 82, Dies; Awarded Medal of Honor
description: Rodolfo Hernandez, who received the Medal of Honor for rushing into heavy fire while wounded and armed with only an inoperable rifle and bayonet and then killing six enemy soldiers during the Korean War, died on Saturday in Fayetteville, N.C. He was 82.

title: A Table That Changes Gears
description: It took 10 years, but the London designer Christopher Duffy thinks he finally got his MK1 Transforming Table right.

title: A Mystery Menagerie
description: Kerman rugs, which originated in 15th-century Persia, feature dense floral patterns and sometimes intricate reproductions of painted masterworks. Modernists consider them old-fashioned. But Mart Guix, the unconventional Spaniard best known for designing inventive eating accessories and environments, has bent the genre for Nanimarquina. His Ghost carpet of hand-knotted wool features birds, flowers, horses and deer that fade in and out of the tapestry. Mr. Guix said that he worked slowly over three months, translating his mood changes into graphic irregularities that give the pattern a touch of mystery.

title: Remembering a Voice for the Region
description: One day during Edward I. Kochs third term, when allegations of corruption were swirling around mayoral allies like Donald R. Manes, the Queens borough president, the radio reporter Stan Brooks stopped Mr. Koch at City Hall. Mr. Brooks, as always, had his microphone in his hand and his tape recorder running.

title: Skin Deep: 1970s Party Hair
description: Follow these easy steps to recreate a 1970s look for festive occasions.

title: Nails That Dazzle for New Years
description: In keeping with the disco spirit for New Years, bedazzling your nails is cheaper and probably more flattering than a Lurex pantsuit.

title: Health Plans and the Middle Class
description: To the Editor:

title: When Sheriffs Ignore Gun Laws They Dont Like
description: To the Editor:

title: On Christmas Eve
A Better Way to Teach
description: To the Editor:

title: For an Elegant Thank-You Note, Paper to Match
description: Just in time to furnish the materials for holiday thank-you notes, Thornwillow Press has opened an in-store boutique among the purveyors of luxury crafts at Atelier Courbet in Little Italy.

title: The Duck March
description: In a daily Memphis tradition, ducks march through the lobby of the Peabody Hotel.

title: Clemency on Drugs
description: To the Editor:

title: Cellphones in Flight?
description: To the Editor:

title: Buy 200: Theyre Small
description: A couples Los Angeles bungalow is packed with curiosities, but it has nothing on their bunker.

title: Always Room for One More
description: LOS ANGELES  Twenty-seven years ago, Bob Breen and Clare Graham began living together in an Arts and Crafts bungalow in the Los Feliz neighborhood here, furnishing it by zealously shopping the flea markets and swap meets of Southern California for vintage dcor. That same year, 1986, they also bought an old supermarket in a sketchy part of the city cut off by freeways.

title: His Refuge from the Digital Din
description: Brian Faherty is the founder of Schoolhouse Electric and Supply, a home dcor company with stores in New York and Portland, Ore., and a robust e-commerce site, but he hasnt adapted easily to the digital world. Nor has he figured out how to resist his smartphone.

title: Skin Deep: 1970s Party Makeup
description: Follow these easy steps to recreate a glamorous 1970s look at home.

title: For One Night, a Trip Back in Time
description: For New Years Eve inspiration this year, one might look to Amy Adamss glamorous 70s makeover on American Hustle (the beauty equivalent of the plunging sequined minidress). Herein, the films hair and makeup experts, along with Gina Brooke, Madonnas makeup artist, and Michael Angelo, a favorite hairstylist of New York social swans, tell how to get the look you want to know better.

title: For Punch or Porridge
description: Although this is the season of festive drinks, Josh Vogel did not have anything like champagne punch in mind when he designed a ladle. He imagined it dispensing more pedestrian nourishment, like oatmeal. But if the spirit moves, he said, why not eggnog, too?

title: The Syrian Electronic Army Is at It Again
description: Its a happy hacker holiday once again.

title: Its the Most Unknowable Time of the Year
description: ONE of my first childhood memories: New Years Eve, Leningrad, 1976. The doorbell rings, my mother opens it, and a bear walks in on his hind legs. Four-year-old me starts trembling. Bear! Bear! Soon I will be eaten. No, my mother tells me: Its Grandfather Frost, the secular, socialist-friendly Russian equivalent of Santa Claus, with New Years standing in for Christmas. And its true. On top of his shabby gray-white fur that makes him so uniquely ursine, the bear sports a red hat and a flowing white beard made of cotton balls.

title: Ruggedly Handsome Lamps
description: An advocate of a laid-back California style, the interior designer Trip Haenisch, 51, works hard to create rooms that dont appear precious. He wants people to feel like they can just jump on a sofa and put their feet up, or move furniture around, he said, even if those people are celebrities. (Courteney Cox and Hank Azaria are among his clients.)

title: Fit for a Queen of Historic Preservation
description: Neither leukemia nor a daunting number of new constructions kept the author of A Field Guide to American Houses from extending her lifes work.

title: Virginia Savage McAlester: Leading the Ultimate House Tour
description: Dallas  If Virginia Savage McAlester were going to die of leukemia, the right time would have been before she ordered a new Texas historical marker for her house. Space on the plaque was at a premium: The 6,000-square-foot home has been in the family since 1921, and her patrician forebears have played an influential role in the city for most of those years.

title: Free Facebook, Common Globally, Finally Comes to American Mobile Phones
description: For years, Facebook has been cutting deals with telecom carriers in developing countries like India and the Philippines to offer free Facebook access to cellphone customers using simple phones with no data plans.

title: When a Politicians Child Goes Astray
description: Politicians strive to control the message. Teenagers and young adults are not known for their ability to stay on script.

title: Wyoming May Act to Plug Abandoned Wells as Natural Gas Boom Ends
description: DENVER  Hundreds of abandoned drilling wells dot eastern Wyoming like sagebrush, vestiges of a natural gas boom that has been drying up in recent years as prices have plummeted.

title: In Germanys Rust Belt, a Polished but Ailing City
description: OBERHAUSEN, Germany  What is it like to be Germanys Detroit, as the news media here has crowned Oberhausen, which for the second year running has received the dubious distinction of being the German city with the highest per capita debt?

title: Alabama Prosecutor Asking Again for Tougher Rape Sentence
description: ATLANTA  An Alabama prosecutor is, for a second time, trying to persuade a judge to impose a tougher sentence on a rapist to whom he gave no prison time.

title: Shadow Carbon Footprints
description: In addition to the carbon dioxide produced inside their borders, countries also add to their emissions tally by consuming goods made elsewhere.

title: Postal Service Raises Price Again but Says Its Not Forever
description: The cost of first-class postage stamps is going up by 3 cents  but only until the Postal Service makes up losses that it has estimated it accumulated during the recession. The increase  to 49 cents from 46 cents  will go into effect on Jan. 26.

title: Brazil: Floods and Landslides Kill 30
description: Heavy rains in Esprito Santo and Minas Gerais, two states in southeastern Brazil, have left at least 30 people dead and forced about 50,000 people from their homes, civil defense authorities said Tuesday. Dozens of cities in both states declared states of emergency after some victims died in landslides and flash floods. President Dilma Rousseff flew to Vitria, the capital of Esprito Santo, where she announced that more than $260 million in public funds would be channeled to disaster relief efforts. Brazils army was also being mobilized to repair bridges in affected areas, officials said. Meteorologists in Esprito Santo said that parts of the state were struggling with the heaviest rains in 90 years.

title: Who Is Selling Targets Data?
description: We may be one step closer to knowing who was behind the security breach at Target that compromised 40 million customer records.

title: Father and Son Share a Passion for Sailing
description: NEWPORT, R.I.  Listen to Rome Kirby, and it was clear by age 10 that he wanted to follow in the wide wake of his father, Jerry, and sail in the Americas Cup and the Volvo Ocean Race. Listen to his parents, and it was clear quite a bit earlier than that.

title: Banks Suit Tests Limits of Resisting Volcker Rule
description: The banks have fired their first salvo in what could soon turn into a war of litigation over the Volcker Rule.

title: When Im Sixty-Four
description: LONDON  It does not seem that long ago that the Beatles could plausibly portray geriatric redundancy as beginning at an age sometimes referred to as young these days. Will you still need me, they asked, Will you still feed me, when Im sixty-four?

title: This Day of Good Cheer
description: This is not the shortest or the darkest or the quietest or even the holiest day of the year. But it is the most joyous and the most richly seasonal. Around Christmas Day orbit the lesser holidays that help account for the texture of this season: days of shopping and decorating, the days of Advent and Christmas Eve, the liturgical 12 days that end in Twelfth Night, better known to most of us as Jan. 5.

title: Marv Wolfenson, 87, Dies; Led an N.B.A. Rebirth in Minnesota
description: Marv Wolfenson, who with his longtime business partner, Harvey Ratner, brought N.B.A. basketball back to Minnesota in the form of the Timberwolves, died on Saturday in the La Jolla section of San Diego. He was 87.

title: The Global Cancer Burden
description: Cancer is on the rise around the world and poses a particular threat in many low- and middle-income countries. Death tolls globally far exceed those from such devastating infectious diseases like AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria. According to recent reports from international health agencies, global mortality from those three diseases has, in fact, been cut substantially  by nearly half in the case of malaria  over the past decade.

title: Companies, Shifting Production, Expand to Accommodate Robots
description: Even a robot needs a home.

title: Frances Operation Butterfly
description: Operation Sangaris, the French intervention in the Central African Republic that began in early December, was pitched to the public and to the United Nations by President Franois Hollandes government as a humanitarian intervention necessary to prevent genocide.

title: Handling Lifes Surprises With His Fathers Spirit
description: Wesley Booker exudes an air of tranquil confidence. But his laid-back manner reflects a staunch assuredness, not nonchalance.

title: BlackBerry Co-Founder Cuts Stake
description: OTTAWA  Mike Lazaridis, a founder and former executive at BlackBerry, took advantage of a rare rise in its share price to cut his stake in the company.

title: Another City by the Bay Comes Into Its Own
description: Long considered San Franciscos little brother  or maybe its punk cousin  Oakland has struggled with negative perceptions wrought by crime, protests and a mediocre football team.

title: Hotel Ducks Gone Wild May End Up in Hunters Sights
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark.  The flooded prairies and backwaters along the Arkansas River are a dangerous place during hunting season for even the toughest of ducks.

title: Start-Up Uses Plant Seeds for a Biofuel
description: SAN DIEGO  In an unmarked greenhouse, leafy bushes carpet an acre of land here tucked into the suburban sprawl of Southern California. The seeds of the inedible, drought-resistant plants, called jatropha, produce a prize: high-quality oil that can be refined into low-carbon jet fuel or diesel fuel.

title: Queensboro Bridge Lane to Be Closed Every Night
description: Cars have slammed into a beauty salon and shattered the windows of a Caribbean restaurant over the years, each after failing to navigate a turn at the base of the Queensboro Bridge where it unspools into Long Island City, Queens.

title: More Hunger for the Poorest Americans
description: This is a harsh season for Americans struggling to afford food. Last month, the long lines at food pantries across the country grew longer with the expiration of the boost to food stamp benefit levels included in the 2009 economic stimulus plan. Those lines are apt to grow even longer thanks to the refusal of House Republicans to renew extended unemployment benefits as part of the recent budget deal.

title: Indiana Finds Its Not So Easy to Buck Gay Marriage Trend
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Dominated by Republicans and steeped in traditional values, Indiana seemed among the least likely places to become a battleground in the nations debate over same-sex marriage when the legislature overwhelmingly chose in 2011 to push forward a state constitutional amendment barring gay couples from marrying.

title: Spitzer and His Wife Say Their Marriage Is Over
description: Eliot Spitzer, the former governor of New York, and his wife, Silda Wall Spitzer, are set to divorce after 26 years of marriage, the couple said Tuesday night.

title: Knicks Vicious Run of Injuries Is Exacting a Toll on Anthony
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Carmelo Anthony was the last player to leave the locker room after Mondays game here against the Magic, and he was dressed for the trip back to New York: slim-fitting slacks, blue sweater, pageboy cap. As far as these things go, he looked composed.

title: Michael R. Stoler
description: Mr. Stoler, 66, is a managing director of Madison Realty Capital, a private equity fund specializing in commercial debt. He is also the president of New York Real Estate TV, where he has produced and hosted several shows, among them The Stoler Report-New Yorks Business Report.

title: As New Services Track Habits, the E-Books Are Reading You
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Before the Internet, books were written  and published  blindly, hopefully. Sometimes they sold, usually they did not, but no one had a clue what readers did when they opened them up. Did they skip or skim? Slow down or speed up when the end was in sight? Linger over the sex scenes?

title: Appeals Court Refuses to Halt Same-Sex Marriages in Utah
description: DENVER  A federal appeals court cleared the wayon Tuesdayfor same-sex marriages to continue across Utah, denying an emergency request from state officials to halt a flood of unions that began after a lower-court judge declared the states ban on same-sex marriage to be unconstitutional.

title: A New Jolt to Filipino Siblings Orphaned by a Typhoon
description: TACLOBAN, the Philippines  Identified as orphans by local officials after Typhoon Haiyan, five siblings ages 8 to 18 were suddenly taken from an evacuation center here, prompting an immediate search by municipal officials and Unicef representatives who feared that human traffickers had abducted them.

title: Op-Art
description: An illustrators pragmatic take on holiday cheer.

title: Freed Russian Applies for Swiss Visa Allowing Travel in 26 Nations
description: GENEVA  Four days after his release from a Russian prison and arrival in Germany, the former oil tycoon Mikhail B. Khodorkovsky has applied for a Swiss visa that would allow him travel to most of Europe, a spokesman for Switzerlands Department of Foreign Affairs said Tuesday.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Dec. 24, 2013
In Familiar Refrain, Prices Rose Again
description: A fanciful splurge over the holidays will cost more than ever this year, at least for those who take their gift cues from the popular holiday classic The Twelve Days of Christmas.

title: For Female Ski Jumpers, Agony of Exclusion Finally Ends
description: Jessica Jerome was in second grade when she asked her parents if she could try ski jumping. Her fathers first thought? No way!

title: Corrections: December 25, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: One Set of Gifts
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Merry Christmas to all those who celebrate! Will Shortz has a nice puzzle gift for you to unravel today.

title: As Rematch Looms, Nets Are No Closer to Finding Themselves
description: The last time the Chicago Bulls were in Brooklyn, they sent the Nets tumbling out of the playoffs and into a period of soul-searching. The Nets were deemed too soft. There was no core, no spine. They would need to be retooled and rebranded.

title: Bloomberg Becomes a Grandfather
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg became a grandfather on Christmas Eve when his daughter Georgina Bloomberg gave birth to his first grandchild.

title: Returning to the Stage, at 55
description: A former Alvin Ailey superstar and a current artificial-hip owner, Elizabeth Roxas-Dobrish, returns to the stage to perform "Revelations," the company's best-known work.

title: With Willing Spirit, a Reprise for Ailey Dancers
description: The voice on the phone belonged to Masazumi Chaya, the associate artistic director of Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, and he had a startling proposition. Would she  Elizabeth Roxas-Dobrish, 55 years old, former Ailey superstar and current artificial-hip owner  come out of retirement to dance at a special performance on New Years Eve?

title: Westchester County Leader Weighs a Run for Governor
description: Although an early poll suggests his bid may be quixotic, Rob Astorino, fresh from an impressive re-election victory for county executive of Westchester, is mulling whether to seek the Republican nomination to challenge Andrew M. Cuomo for governor next year.

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, December 25, 2013
description: When youre younger, you have everything  you have the flexibility, you have no fear. But you dont savor every step, every movement of every fingertip, every beat of the music. I feel like Im tasting food for the first time.

title: For Fitness, Intensity Matters
description: This year, exercise science expanded and fine-tuned our understanding of how physical activity affects our brains, joints, hearts, and even genes, beginning before birth and continuing throughout our lifespans, which can be lengthened, it seems, by exercise, especially if we pick up the pace.

title: Welfare Benefits for Big Business
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: Tanaka Mystery Now Has an Ending: In U.S.
description: Masahiro Tanaka, the pitching ace who went 24-0 in 2013 as he led the Tohoku Rakuten Golden Eagles to a Japan Series title, will be allowed to sign with a major league team for the 2014 season, becoming the latest Japanese star to be allowed to leave for the United States before he became a free agent.

title: Whats on Wednesday
description: 9 P.M. (BBC America) DOCTOR WHO Matt Smith, left, takes his final bow as the Doctor in this Christmas special, and its a doozy. He will face Cybermen, Daleks, Weeping Angels and the Silence, but his greatest challenge might be playing the part of the boyfriend for Clara (Jenna Coleman) at her familys Christmas dinner. Peter Capaldi is also set to appear as the 12th incarnation of the Doctor.

title: Rockets Fired by Taliban Hit U.S. Embassy in Kabul
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A pair of rockets fired by the Taliban struck the United States Embassy in Kabul shortly before dawn on Wednesday, sending hundreds of American diplomats and aid workers based at the mission scrambling into fortified bunkers to start their Christmas Day, the embassy said.

title: Answers to the Year in Questions
description: Compare your answers to the questions.

title: Image of the Day: December 25
Corruption Scandal Is Edging Near Turkish Premier
description: ISTANBUL  A corruption investigation that has encircled the Turkish government moved an ominous step closer to Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Wednesday, as three top ministers whose sons have been implicated abruptly resigned  and one of them, on his way out the door, said Mr. Erdogan should step down as well.

title: Celebrating Christmas in China
description: When I was a little girl, I raised money for missionaries who were taking Bibles into China. As the daughter of a preacher, it was one of many similar projects I undertook, like going door to door to collect money for starving children in Africa and gathering wheelchairs and crutches to send to missionary doctors in South America.

title: In Our Pages: December 26
description: 1888: Travels of a Post Card

title: Personal Tragedy, Tricorders and the Idea of Mapping Ones Body
description: When Walter De Brouwer puts his head to something, he can produce single-handedly what usually takes several hospital machines and labs. His single hand, it should be said, holds a small and promising device with which Mr. De Brouwer, the co-founder and chief executive of Scanadu, hopes to remake medicine.

title: Game Theory: The Year of the Indie
description: Increasingly this year, Ive enjoyed games made by passionate coteries of video game artisans, so much so that for me this is the Year of the Indie. Not that independent games are new. The other day, cold and shivering, I arrived early at the Museum of the Moving Images Indie Essentials exhibition to take in 25 games quietly, meditatively. I was warmed, then moved, by this recent history of indies, spartanly staged in low light, each a gem of shining creativity.

title: An Armenian Christmas Surprise
description: Dear Diary,

title: Worshipers Are Targeted at a Christmas Service in Baghdad
description: BAGHDAD  At least 26 people were killed and 38 others were wounded on Wednesday when a car bomb exploded in a parking lot near St. Johns Roman Catholic Church in a southern neighborhood of Baghdad, according to police and medical officials.

title: China Investigates Vaccine Maker After Deaths of Infants
description: SHANGHAI  Health authorities in China are investigating one of the nations biggest vaccine makers after eight infants died in the past two months following injections that were meant to immunize them against hepatitis B.

title: BEST OF 2013
description: These 15 stories demonstrated why (and how) guys are dressing better than ever.

title: Daily Report: E-Book Services Track Readers Habits
description: Before the Internet, David Streitfeld reports, books were written  and published  blindly, hopefully. Sometimes they sold, usually they did not, but no one had a clue what readers did when they opened them up. Did they skip or skim? Slow down or speed up when the end was in sight? Linger over the sex scenes?

title: Journalist Is Beaten in Latest Attack on Ukrainian Opposition
description: MOSCOW  A crusading antigovernment journalist and activist in Ukraine who became famous last year after documenting the opulence of the heavily guarded residential compound of President Viktor F. Yanukovich was savagely beaten early Wednesday.

title: App Smart: Equipping New Devices
description: A selection of great apps to get you going with a new smartphone or tablet.

title: Basic Apps for Your New Smartphone or Tablet
description: So youve got a brand-new smartphone or tablet. Its gleaming screen is hypnotic. It feels like the future as it nestles, or perhaps just perches, in your hand. But until you download some apps, all its amazing 21st-century potential is unrealized. Yet there are millions of apps to choose from. Where to start?

title: The Rat Takes the Cheese
description: Eek! Mice and rats are constantly scampering around childrens literature (Aesops fables; E.T.A. Hoffmanns Nutcracker and Mouse-King; Beatrix Potters The Tale of Two Bad Mice), but theres usually a difference between the two. Though mice are often portrayed as naughty, they are rarely as utterly repellent as rats. The sweet Mouse House Tales, by Susan Pearson with illustrations by Amanda Shepherd, and the hilarious and down-and-dirty Cheese Belongs to You!, by Alexis Deacon with illustrations by Viviane Schwarz, perpetuate this traditional polarity. But whatever your feelings about rodents, these two books shouldnt be missed, even if you have to perch on a chair to read them.

title: Home iMovies on Your iPhone
description: Home movies are increasingly being filmed on the smart phone. Here is how to do it using iMovie, from Apple.

title: 1895: Christmas in Herald Square
Unlocking Your Inner Movie Director (and Editor)
description: Making and showing home movies used to require clunky cameras and film projectors, or at least a VCR. Wrangling friends and family to sit down on the couch and watch them was often the easy part.

title: Best of 2013 | The Year in Mens Fashion
TV Message by Snowden Says Privacy Still Matters
description: LONDON  In a message broadcast Wednesday on British television, Edward J. Snowden, the former American security contractor, urged an end to mass surveillance, arguing that the electronic monitoring he has exposed surpasses anything imagined by George Orwell in 1984, a dystopian vision of an all-knowing state.

title: Why Corporations Might Not Mind Moderate Depression
description: Yes, its Christmas  but the family events wont begin for hours yet, and I want to follow up on a train of thought I started yesterday.

title: South Sudans President Condemns Ethnic Killings
description: JUBA, South Sudan  As heavy fighting between government forces and rebels continued in South Sudan on Wednesday, President Salva Kiir spoke out against ethnically motivated killings in a Christmas address.

title: Classical Playlist: Thomas Ads, Benjamin Hochman, Angela Hewitt and More
description: LIEUX RETROUVSSteven Isserlis, cellist; Thomas Ads, pianist; works by Liszt, Janacek, Faur, Gyorgy Kurtag, Mr. Ads.(Hyperion)The British composer Thomas Ads wrote Lieux retrouvs (Revisited Places), a moody, ingenious and fiendishly difficult 18-minute cello and piano duo, specifically for his colleague and countryman Steven Isserlis, the brilliant cellist. Mr. Ads, a formidable pianist, plays the pieces with Mr. Isserlis on an exciting recording along with works by Liszt, Janacek, Faur and Gyorgy Kurtag  an inspired grouping of diverse composers that highlights surprising musical connections between their styles. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: Kanye West Faces Lawsuit Over Song Sample
description: The Kanye West track Bound 2 has already become one of the most recognizable songs from his album Yeezus, helped along by a video in which he and his fiance, Kim Kardashian, recreate an amorous moment, and by widespread online parodies of said video. But the song proved especially familiar to Ricky Spicer, a soul singer who is suing Mr. West for what he says is the unauthorized use of his voice on the track, according to The Hollywood Reporter.

title: The Pixies Join Festival Lineup in Israel
description: More than three years after canceling a planned performance in Israel, the Pixies are once again scheduled to play there as part of a new music festival in June. The Israeli newspaper Haaretz reported that the band would perform on a bill that also includes Soundgarden at a two-day festival scheduled for June 17 and 18 at Bloomfield Stadium in Tel Aviv.

title: Italian Posters for 12 Years a Slave Prompt Race Debate
description: In America and throughout the world, the Steve McQueen film 12 Years a Slave is known for its searing depiction of a black mans life in bondage during the 1800s and a widely praised performance by its leading man, Chiwetel Ejiofor. But, in the eyes of a company distributing the movie in Italy, the film was apparently more notable for its white co-stars Brad Pitt and Michael Fassbender.

title: 36 Hours in South Beach, Miami Beach
description: A weekend in South Beach ought not to begin with What to pack? but rather, What to pursue? Do you long for the South Beach of painted-on dresses, frozen margaritas and electric neon? The South Beach of stylish new (or renovated) hotels (Gale, Lord Balfour, SLS South Beach) and restaurants (Yardbird Southern Table & Bar, Khong River House, Tongue & Cheek)? Or the South Beach of yesteryear, of pastel Art Deco buildings, museums and monuments? Perhaps you simply crave ...the beach. Miami can be whatever you want it to be  laid back, decked out, gay, straight, a family recess, a singles playground  which is precisely what makes it such an effortless getaway. In this dreamland at the southern tip of Miami Beach, you can choose your own adventure.

title: Pope, Off Script, Nods to Atheists in Holiday Call for World Peace
description: ROME  Pope Francis used the first Christmas address of his papacy on Wednesday to make a broad call for global peace and an end to violence in Syria and parts of Africa, urging atheists and followers of other religions to join together in this common cause.

title: A Savvy Investors Spiritual Exploration
description: A biographical film about a brand-name investor might not seem like holiday fare, but in two respects Contrarian, a documentary about John M. Templeton, seems just right for the day after Christmas.

title: Christmas Around the World
description: From a NATO camp in Afghanistan to a picturesque beach in Australia, heres a look at how people across the globe celebrated the holiday.

title: A Teasing Online Return for Sherlock
description: There was never a doubt that Benedict Cumberbatch would return to the role of Sherlock Holmes, the modernized incarnation of Arthur Conan Doyles consulting detective he plays on the hit BBC series Sherlock. Despite a second-season finale in 2012 that seemed to show Holmes falling to his death, Mr. Cumberbatchs star has risen considerably since then (in films like Star Trek Into Darkness and The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug), and besides, the BBC had already committed to a third season of Sherlock. (The series is shown in the United States on PBSs Masterpiece.)

title: Bypassing Fear and Embracing Networking
description: We just publisheda conversation with Hanny Lerner, the founder and president of MOD Restoration, a furniture reupholstering company in Brooklyn. In the interview, Ms. Lerner, 29, who grew up in a Hasidic community with limited information about the outside world, discussed how she managed to get up to speed and grow her business, which had 2013 sales of just under $2 million and employs about 10.

title: Mapping a Darker Side of New York
description: New York City has long been associated with crime, in drama and in reality. From early bootlegging and street hustles to stock market frauds that have caused the global financial market to shudder, its fair to say that the city has had its share of bad actors.

title: A Brooklyn Church Uncovers a Long-Hidden Celestial Scene
description: At Christmas, thoughts at many churches turn to a certain star.

title: Egypt, Dealing a Blow to the Muslim Brotherhood, Deems It a Terrorist Group
description: CAIRO  Egypts military-backed leaders on Wednesday designated the Muslim Brotherhood a terrorist organization, outlawing the countrys most successful political movement and vowing to treat anyone who belongs to it, or even takes part in its activities, as a terrorist.

title: Nets Effort Questioned, by Fans and by Coach
description: The chorus of boos and jeers started with about half a minute left in the game, when Tornike Shengelia tried to dribble the ball behind his back but instead felt it stripped away. Shengelia, an infrequently used reserve, was far from the object of the fans ire, but he was the Nets player unfortunate enough to be standing there when it all finally boiled over.

title: Handel Well Populated, Onstage and Off
description: The Oratorio Society, under the direction of Kent Tritle, performed Handels Messiah in front of a capacity crowd on Monday at Carnegie Hall. The stage was also filled to capacity. The societys choir has close to 200 singers. The alto section alone, with 59 members, is more than twice as big as, say, the entire Choir of Trinity Wall Street, whose Messiah I also reviewed this month.

title: Feeling For | Ugo Rondinones Miniature, Wearable Art
description: Art is my job and my passion. I look at it, think about it, talk about it and write about it. Now, thanks to the artist Ugo Rondinone, I dream of wearing it. Rondinone made a splash earlier this year when an installation of his nine colossal stone sculptures, often likened to Stonehenge, inhabited Rockefeller Center. A few months later, in collaboration with the creative couple Sebastien and Stephanie Jannssen, Rondinone created mythical little masks that fit into the palm of your hand. The seven 23-karat-gold sculptures, created in a limited edition of six (plus three artists proofs), represent each day of the week and can be worn as a pendant. This enigmatic piece is sure to cure any case of the Mondays by making even the most cynical among us smile. Like most great works, its an investment piece. But as any art lover will tell you, its impossible to own all the art you want. Thats what dreams are for. Price upon request; sorrywereclosed.com.

title: Dempsey to Help Fulham, and Himself
description: Clint Dempsey has heeded the call of Jurgen Klinsmann, coach of the United States national team, to get some playing time in Europe during Major League Soccers off-season and has heeded the desperate call of Fulham, one of his former teams, to help rescue the London club from relegation.

title: How a Bridge Deal Can Resemble a Boxing Match
description: In Britain and other countries in the Commonwealth, Dec. 26 is known as Boxing Day. It has nothing to do with pugilism. Instead, in the Middle Ages, the landed gentry would deliver gifts in boxes to their serfs on this day.

title: Newly Released Books
description: This month, a novel that conjures an imaginary city, an elegant book of poems complemented by haunting paintings, two dark collections of short stories where nothing is as it seems, and two rugged graphic novels with enjoyably ragged edges.

title: Liu Pings Christmas in Jail
description: Liu Ping, a democracy advocate, doesnt talk much about her Christian faith, preferring to talk about politics. But Christmas means something to her.

title: From One Garage in Queens, a World of Fakes
description: Court papers in one of more than a half dozen lawsuits filed against a defunct Manhattan gallery, Knoedler & Co., reveal just how far the fakes it sold had spread before the fraud was discovered.

title: A Honcho in Winter With More Tales to Tell
description: In 1998, Robert Evans, the least bashful producer in Hollywood, suffered three strokes in rapid succession. Their combined effects were so debilitating that it was not clear whether Mr. Evans would ever walk, talk or chase women again. But as his new memoir, The Fat Lady Sang, makes clear, at least Mr. Evanss capacity for bragging and self-promotion remained mercifully unimpaired. He is still able to say Wham, bam, there I am in as many ways as this stubbornly upbeat book will allow.

title: Apples for a Seasoned Acting Teacher
description: As other acting students watched in a darkened rehearsal studio, Alan Safier, a 64-year-old theater veteran, stepped toward a spotlight to begin a monologue from Shaws Caesar and Cleopatra. His eyes wide, Mr. Safier delivered his first line in a low, awe-struck tone.

title: The Confidence, and the Art, Looked Real
description: To many people, the art dealer Jose Carlos Bergantios Diaz seemed like an enviable man.

title: Using an iPad With Linux
description: Using an iPad

title: Finding the Drama in the Boss and Dylan
description: Nobody knows better than the British chanteuse Barb Jungr that even the most seemingly banal pop song lyrics have hidden wellsprings of intense feeling. It is the performers job to dig into the ground and bring up a gusher.

title: Trove of Information From the 1930s, Animated by the Internet
description: In 1932, when Charles O. Paullin published his monumental Atlas of the Historical Geography of the United States, reviewers were overwhelmed by its nearly 700 maps covering seemingly every facet of the countrys social, economic and political life, including maps, then novel, showing county-by-county results for presidential elections going back to the beginning of the Republic.

title: Evolving Young Satirist Stands Up to Convention
description: If any comedian could have a midlife crisis at 23, it would be Bo Burnham.

title: Japanese Start-Ups Channel Samurai Spirit
description: The Samurai Startup Island, in a low-rent office district built on a landfill on Tokyo Bay, is at the vanguard of what many hope is a new generation of innovators.

title: Start-Up Spirit Emerges in Japan
description: TOKYO  The 20-somethings in jeans sipping espresso and tapping on laptops at this Tokyo business incubator would look more at home in Silicon Valley than in Japan, where for years the surest signs of success were the gray suits of its corporate salarymen. But for those hoping the nations latest economic plan will drag Japan from its long malaise, the young men and women here at Samurai Startup Island represent a crucial component: a revival of entrepreneurship.

title: Owner of Forgotten Clock Finds a Name (and Hands) to Put With the Face
description: For the last 20 years, the priciest curio from what was called the biggest yard sale of the 20th century lay undiscovered, but not unappreciated, in Barry Lubetkins apartment on the Upper East Side.

title: Anthony Is Out, and Knicks Are Helpless Against Thunder
description: The Knicks problems may have begun when Carmelo Anthony arrived for pregame warm-ups Wednesday wearing a brown blazer and grabbed a seat on the bench.

title: Gun Laws and the Mentally Ill
description: To the Editor:

title: Human Cost of Demolition
description: To the Editor:

title: Bigotry, Then and Now
description: To the Editor:

title: Cancers Racial Gap
description: To the Editor:

title: Triage and Food Stamps
description: To the Editor:

title: The Price of E-Books
description: To the Editor:

title: Round-the-Clock Giddiness in a 24-Hour Music Video
description: One afternoon this fall Tyler, the Creator, and his buddies Earl Sweatshirt and Jasper Dolphin, of the rap collective Odd Future, turned up on a street corner in downtown Los Angeles. Their agenda: to shoot a cameo for the music video Happy, by Pharrell Williams.

title: Choosing to Be Naughty
description: ADS for fitness clubs and weight loss programs typically sell the notion that getting in shape will give consumers a confidence boost to get that promotion or date. But a new campaign from Equinox fitness takes the unusual approach of saying that getting in shape may get you in trouble.

title: Swiss Group Tries to Bring Grangemouth Plant to Profitability
description: Grangemouth is only one outpost in the global empire of James A. Ratcliffe, but he has said that profitable units in the United States and elsewhere should not subsidize those losing money in Britain.

title: The Cradle of Scotland's Refining Prowess
description: Grangemouths place in the chemical and oil industries goes back more than a century.

title: A Refinery That Looms Over Scotland
description: The Grangemouth refinery complex has roots to the 1920s glory days of British industry and is a linchpin to the nations economy.

title: Scotland Fights to Keep Energy Lifeline
description: GRANGEMOUTH, Scotland  The vast petrochemical complex at Grangemouth is a constellation of lights and glowing plumes of steam west of Edinburgh that has become a shimmering symbol of Scotland at an economic and political crossroads.

title: Snowden's Christmas Message
description: Edward J. Snowden delivered an alternative Christmas message on British television. The former American security contractor warned of the dangers posed by the loss of privacy.

title: Barbara Branden, Biographer of Ayn Rand, Dies at 84
description: Barbara Branden, who helped popularize Ayn Rands philosophy of self-interest in the 1960s but caused a schism among Ms. Rands followers with an unauthorized biography she wrote after the theorists death, died on Dec. 11 in West Hollywood, Calif. She was 84.

title: A Work Still in Progress
description: When the country observed the Constitutions 200th anniversary back in 1987, two narratives vied for public acceptance. There was the triumphalist narrative celebrated in Philadelphia, where a quarter-million people took part in a 15-hour-long gala, lining the route for a parade with floats that included a 40-foot replica of a parchment scroll.

title: An Ode to Spam
description: I would like to take time now to thank everyone who sent me holiday messages via the Internet: The wishes of good cheer, the reports of family achievements in the year past, and the multiple requests for my email or bank password.

title: Common Knee Surgery Does Very Little for Some, Study Suggests
description: A popular surgical procedure worked no better than fake operations in helping people with one type of common knee problem, suggesting that thousands of people may be undergoing unnecessary surgery, a new study in The New England Journal of Medicine reports.

title: Islamic Banks, Stuffed With Cash, Explore Partnerships in West
description: A noted Muslim law scholar, Yusuf DeLorenzo, recently pored through the books of Continental Rail, a business that runs freight trains up and down the East Coast.

title: Rescuing a Predator
description: The largest crocodile in South America is on the verge of extinction, and government and private efforts to rescue the species are having limited success.

title: Venezuelas Fitful Effort to Save a Scaly Predator
description: MANTECAL, Venezuela  Stealing the eggs from an enraged, 10-foot crocodile is a delicate operation.

title: Highlights from Pope's Christmas Message
description: Pope Francis delivered his first Christmas message from the Vatican.

title: Week 17 N.F.L. Game Probabilities: Romos Bad Rap
description: The final game of the regular season will decide the winner of the N.F.C. East. The Eagles visit a wounded Cowboys team that will very likely be without its starting quarterback, Tony Romo. The conventional wisdom about Romo is that hes a very skilled quarterback who can put up solid numbers each year, but that he somehow lacks the nerves to succeed in the clutch.

title: An Entrepreneur Who Wouldnt Be Stopped by Anything
description: Hanny Lerner estimates that 80 percent of her customers find her company, MOD Restoration, at the website she designed. Ms. Lerner, 29, does not code, but she has experience in user-interface design and created the screen blueprints for her site.

title: Michael Bloomberg: Big Brother or Pioneer?
Wind Power Developers Race Clock to Secure Subsidy
description: As the rest of the world prepares to toast the new year, the wind industry is hard at work on its own year-end tradition, rushing to make sure projects qualify for an important subsidy before it is set to vanish at the stroke of midnight on Tuesday.

title: The Night Pittsburgh Became a Baseball Town Once Again
description: For many years, the Pittsburgh Pirates played their home games at Three Rivers Stadium, a home they shared with the Steelers at the confluence of the Allegheny, Ohio and Monongahela Rivers. It was a picturesque setting, except that the upper bowl encircled the ballpark and blotted out any sense of place.

title: Pettersen Stars in a Supporting Role
description: Suzann Pettersen of Norway won four tournaments, including her second major at the Evian Championship. She recorded two third-place finishes and a tie for fourth in three of the years other majors, faltering only at the United States Womens Open, where she missed the cut. She had 10 top-three finishes on the L.P.G.A. Tour and was on the victorious Solheim Cup team, which in any other year would have won her mountains of attention and possibly the Player of the Year award.

title: In California, a Mayors Rise Is a Sign of the Times
description: SEBASTOPOL, Calif.  When Robert Jacob ran for the City Council here last year, he had already made the list of Forty Under 40 of 2012 in a local business magazine. So it was to be expected that his business gave him face recognition among voters on the campaign trail, many of whom greeted him by exclaiming, Youre the pot guy!

title: Gifts Sent by U.P.S. Miss a Big Deadline
description: Santa delivered sacks stuffed with i.o.u.s this Christmas.

title: In a Car-Culture Clash, Its the Los Angeles Police vs. Pedestrians
description: LOS ANGELES  In a city of seemingly endless highways  with its daily parade of car accidents, frustrating traffic jams and aggressive drivers  the Los Angeles Police Department these days is training its sights on a different road menace: jaywalkers.

title: In Final Weeks, a Push to Put Bloombergs Stamp on Major Legal Cases
description: In the Bloomberg administrations final weeks, New York Citys Law Department has been actively trying to settle some of its longest-running court battles and, where that has failed, to at least put its stamp on significant legal cases before Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio takes office.

title: Small Theaters in Adirondacks Face Choice in Switch to Digital: Pay or Perish
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y.  Some nights, it is so cold that not even those who live here venture outside, so the Palace Theater closes early rather than show movies to an empty house.

title: Despite New Evidence, Review of Conviction in 1989 Brooklyn Killing Stalls
description: Jonathan Fleming had been in prison for 23 years  for a murder he insisted he did not commit  before things began to look up this spring: After reinterviewing witnesses who had implicated him in his 1990 trial, his lawyer turned up evidence that he said could lead to Mr. Flemings release.

title: In Need of Help, but Not the Emergency Room
description: A program in Wake County, N.C., trains paramedics to perform mental health exams on patients in the field.

title: E.R. Costs for Mentally Ill Soar, and Hospitals Seek Better Way
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  As darkness fell on a Friday evening over downtown Raleigh, N.C., Michael Lyons, a paramedic supervisor for Wake County Emergency Medical Services, slowly approached the tall, lanky man who was swaying back and forth in a gentle rhythm.

title: Eczema and Holy Water
description: My 9-month-old sons first time on a plane  a 10-hour journey from J.F.K. to Istanbul  was a disaster. The dry air of the cabin, the confinement and possibly some allergen on the in-flight menu all contributed to an unprecedented eruption of his eczema. It was demoralizing. His skin had been cracking and inflamed for months, but we had taken such pains with it  daily applications of heavy cream and austere dietary restrictions  in anticipation of introducing him to his relatives in Turkey.

title: Through Art, Coping With Depression and a Death
description: Disorder has come to characterize Robinette Christians life of late.

title: Poison Gas Kills Eight Left in Dark After Storm
description: With downed power lines forcing hundreds of thousands to spend Christmas without electricity, ice storms that raged through the Northeast and the Midwest continued to have a deadly effect as carbon monoxide given off by gasoline-powered generators killed three Americans and five Canadians, officials said.

title: Homeland Securitys New Chief
description: The Senate has confirmed Jeh Johnson, once the Pentagons top lawyer, to lead the Department of Homeland Security. Mr. Johnson brings a sharp legal mind and reputation for probity to the job. He will need both to manage the department, a daunting agglomeration of agencies and missions and chronic management problems.

title: Getting Out of Discount Game, Small Colleges Lower the Price
description: SPARTANBURG, S.C.  A higher education riddle: When can a college slash tuition by almost half, without losing revenues? Answer: When nobody much pays full tuition anyway.

title: A Rivalry Goes Unfulfilled as the Lakers Fall to the Heat
description: LOS ANGELES  Kobe Bryant, a creature of habit and one of symbolism, too, acknowledged it was a strange feeling to wake up on Christmas morning for the first time in 15 seasons without a basketball game to play.

title: A Step Toward Affordable Housing
description: Representative Melvin Watt, a Democrat of North Carolina, who was confirmed earlier this month as the director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency, will need to use all of his agencys powers to cope with a worsening affordable housing crisis that is placing poor and elderly Americans at risk of homelessness and forcing many of the nations 43 million renters to skimp on food and medical care to meet the rent.

title: Mistaken Ruling on Contraception
description: The contraception mandate in the new health care reform law accommodates religious beliefs. It exempts houses of worship from having to provide contraceptive coverage without a co-pay. Church-affiliated organizations like schools and hospitals need only send a short form to their insurance administrator, which takes care of the coverage.

title: Farewell
description: The first Rural Life appeared on the editorial page nearly 16 years ago. This is the last. This seems a good season to leave, with a long winter ahead, the wood stove burning, and plenty of hopes and plans for the coming year. When The Rural Life began, I didnt imagine that it would last so long or chart so many changes in my life. Nor did I imagine that it would find so many good readers. But it has, and Im grateful for that.

title: Bloomberg Checking In on Fallen Workers Families
description: The phone call came as a surprise.

Quotation of the Day for Thursday, December 26, 2013
description: What it does is it inhibits the vitality of Los Angeles. When you go to New York, when you go to Chicago, when its safe to cross the street, you just cross the street. You just do it.

title: Yankees Know Risks of Splurging on Japanese Aces
description: Friday is the seventh anniversary of one of Brian Cashmans more disastrous moments in his long run as general manager of the Yankees. On Dec. 27, 2006, Cashman signed off on a five-year, $20 million contract for the Japanese left-hander Kei Igawa, a pitcher who, in the seasons that followed, went on to win two games for the Yankees while spending most of his time out of sight and out of mind in the minor leagues.

title: New Tests for Brain Trauma Create Hope, and Skepticism
description: Revelations in recent years that thousands of former football players might have severe brain trauma from injuries sustained on the field have set off a rush in the medical community to seize the potentially lucrative market for assessing brain damage. But experts say claims regarding the validity of these assessments are premature and perhaps unfounded.

title: In Announcing Unfavorable News, Timing Is Everything
description: In the celebrated tradition of dumping unfavorable news on holidays, weekends or days when the media is otherwise preoccupied, New York Citys political folk spun a little frenzy before ducking out on Christmas Eve.

description: FRONT PAGE

title: Its Chaos, I Tell You
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Raise your hand if you finished this puzzle and you still werent sure what the theme was. Yup, me too.

title: U.S. Sends Arms to Aid Iraq Fight With Extremists
description: WASHINGTON  The United States is quietly rushing dozens of Hellfire missiles and low-tech surveillance drones to Iraq to help government forces combat an explosion of violence by a Qaeda-backed insurgency that is gaining territory in both western Iraq and neighboring Syria.

title: Thrust Into Role, Knicks Udrih Is Thrown Off His Game
description: Beno Udrihs first pass on Wednesday at Madison Square Garden was intercepted by Russell Westbrook.

title: Identical Twins? Yes. Identical Wins? No Way.
description: New Yorks hapless N.B.A. teams  the Knicks and the Nets  have the same record (9-19) through Wednesdays wipeouts. They have lost on the same day seven times this season. Not once have they won in tandem.

title: Japanese Premier Visits Contentious War Shrine
description: TOKYO  Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan visited a contentious Tokyo war shrine early on Thursday, provoking swift condemnation from China and South Korea, both victims of Japans wartime aggression.

title: Obamas Celebrate Christmas in Hawaii
description: HONOLULU  President Obama took a break from opening gifts and singing carols with his family on Christmas Day, and spoke to about 580 military troops in Hawaii, where he and his family are spending their winter break, thanking them for their service.

title: Tropical Prints that Transport
description: Despite the winter wonderland outside, its decidedly tropical in stores thanks to the bright colors and warm-weather prints in this seasons resort collections. The chic grandchildren of the Hawaiian shirt, statement separates like a colorful, palm-printed skirt from Fausto Puglisi beg to be paired with basic palettes and clean lines. And from the bright stones on an Annelise Michelson necklace, an upscale version of Panamanian street market finds, to the sandy-colored backdrop on a Prada bag emblazoned with a vintage hula girl, the often-kitschy theme is being reinvented into a motif that the modern woman can get behind without having to travel to a hot and humid destination.

title: Preventing Civil War in South Sudan
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: A Nurse Gains Fame in the Days of Polio
description: In the years after World War II, polls perennially showed that Eleanor Roosevelt was the woman whom Americans admired most in the world. But in a 1951 Gallup poll, that distinction went to an Australian nurse, Elizabeth Kenny, popularly known as Sister Kenny.

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 10:35 A.M. (Cinemax) SHAUN OF THE DEAD (2004) In this horror comedy directed by Edgar Wright, Simon Pegg plays Shaun, a worthless layabout who seems content to go nowhere fast just as long as he can hang out at his favorite pub with his best friend, Ed (Nick Frost), and his girlfriend, Liz (Kate Ashfield). But when Liz dumps Shaun, he decides to get his life together to win her back. Of course theres also the small matter of a zombie apocalypse going on outside his door. Writing in The New York Times, Stephen Holden said that the film skillfully satirized the zombie genre by implying that Britain may already be populated with the living dead, metaphorically speaking. He added, The motley Londoners who face down the creatures are so inept and unthinking in their response to the catastrophe that the uncharitable part of you may decide that they deserve their probable (but not guaranteed) fates during what panicked television commentators label Z-Day.

title: With Shrine Visit, Leader Asserts Japans Track From Pacifism
description: TOKYO  Shinzo Abes past year as prime minister has concentrated chiefly on reviving Japans long-ailing economy. Yet in Mr. Abes mind, the countrys newfound economic prowess is a means to an end: to build a more powerful, assertive Japan, complete with a full-fledged military, as well as pride in its World War II-era past.

title: Thai Election Body Urges Vote Delay as Unrest Flares
description: BANGKOK  After chaotic clashes between the police and antigovernment protesters in Bangkok on Thursday left one police officer dead and dozens of people injured, the Election Commission of Thailand urged that national elections scheduled for Feb. 2 be postponed, further clouding the countrys future after a month of debilitating street protests.

title: Documenting the World for 125 Years
description: So, you want to see the Great Sphinx, but dont have the big bucks for an Egyptian jaunt. Easy  go to your computer, type a few words into a search engine and within seconds thousands of images pop up for your viewing pleasure. Prefer to see the timeless creature at sunset, drenched in warm orange hues? Sure. Curious to see different angles? No problem.

title: Dont Trash Colombias Democracy
description: BOGOT, Colombia  On Dec. 9, I was giving a talk at City Hall on the need to fight corruption when, suddenly, my cellphone alerted me to this message: Colombias inspector general had decided to remove me from my job as mayor of the nations capital and to bar me from holding office for 15 years.

title: African Leaders Press for Peace in South Sudan
description: JUBA, South Sudan  As clashes between government troops and rebels continued in South Sudan on Thursday, diplomats moved swiftly to drag the warring sides to the negotiating table but announced none of the breakthroughs they had hoped for.

title: Bad Scripts and Politics Make for a Bad Year in Tollywood
description: HYDERABAD, Andhra Pradesh  Bollywood, the movie-making machine based in Mumbai, may be the best-known Indian film industry globally, but farther south in Andhra Pradesh, there is another that churns out more films each year and has a more intensely devoted following, so much that entertainment is inextricably linked with the states turbulent politics.

title: Egypt Broadens New Crackdown on Brotherhood
description: CAIRO  Just a day after Egypts military-backed government declared the Muslim Brotherhood a terrorist group, a more aggressive crackdown was already emerging Thursday, as the authorities announced dozens of arrests across the country, and the seizure of land, stocks and vehicles belonging to the Islamist movements members.

title: Software for Sorting Out Child Support
description: Getting divorced, particularly when children are involved, can be a hard and messy business, rife with mediators, lawyers and courts. Its little remarked how hard the realities of the situation can be afterward, when people are on their own.

title: Prosecutor Overseeing Turkish Graft Inquiry Is Removed From Case
description: ISTANBUL  An Istanbul prosecutor who had been overseeing a sprawling corruption investigation of the prime ministers inner circle was removed from the case on Thursday, in a new sign of a profound power struggle over Turkeys judiciary and police forces.

title: Game Theory: BioShock Infinite and Video Game Reviews
description: After years of debate about the artistic merit of video games, the question of the mediums artistic worth looks to have finally been decided. I say this in reference to the critical reaction surrounding BioShock Infinite, the first-person shooter from Irrational Games and one of this years most popular titles.

description: 1888: Duke, Duchess Escape Bomb

title: Game Theory: A Golden Era for Criticism
description: Bemoaning the state of games criticism has been fashionable since at least 2006, when Chuck Klosterman wondered in Esquire why there was no Lester Bangs of video games. I suspect if you flipped  or, more likely, pointed and clicked  through my archive you could find me mourning something similar.

description: Dear Diary:

title: BEST OF 2013
